com.orbitz.monitoring.api
Interface InheritableStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
MapBasedInheritableStrategy, NoOpInheritableStrategy, StackBasedInheritableStrategy
public interface InheritableStrategy

Represents how the MonitoringEngine handles inheritable attributes. Not all methods may be supported by all inheritable strategies.

getCompositeMonitorNamed

CompositeMonitor getCompositeMonitorNamed(java.lang.String name)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Obtains the first CompositeMonitor found on the per thread stack that has its name attribute equal to the supplied name. This method should be used in situations where stateless code is unable to hold a reference to the CompositeMonitor that was originally created. Supplying the name value is needed to ensure that instrumentation errors in code called by users of this method does not interfere with the ability to correctly obtain the original CompositeMonitor.

Parameters:
name - the value of name that our Monitor was created with.
Returns:
the first CompositeMonitor with the supplied name, or null if not found
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null

getInheritableAttributes

java.util.Map getInheritableAttributes()
Returns the current inheritable attributes for this thread.

Returns:
the inheritable attributes that would be applied to a monitor if it were made right now, or an empty Map if there are none
